section: imgui.h Go to the documentation of this file.1 // dear imgui, v1.90.5 WIP 2 // (headers) 3 4 // Help: 5 // - See links below. 6 // - Call and read ImGui::ShowDemoWindow() in imgui_demo.cpp. All applications in examples/ are doing that. 7 // - Read top of imgui.cpp for more details, links and comments. 8 9 // Resources: 10 // - FAQ https://dearimgui.com/faq 11 // - Getting Started https://dearimgui.com/getting-started 12 // - Homepage https://github.com/ocornut/imgui 13 // - Releases & changelog https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/releases 14 // - Gallery https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/issues/6897 (please post your screenshots/video there!) 15 // - Wiki https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/wiki (lots of good stuff there) 16 // - Glossary https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/wiki/Glossary 17 // - Issues & support https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/issues 18 // - Tests & Automation https://github.com/ocornut/imgui_test_engine 19 20 // For first-time users having issues compiling/linking/running/loading fonts: 21 // please post in https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/discussions if you cannot find a solution in resources above. 22 // Everything else should be asked in 'Issues'! We are building a database of cross-linked knowledge there. 23 24 // Library Version 25 // (Integer encoded as XYYZZ for use in #if preprocessor conditionals, e.g. '#if IMGUI_VERSION_NUM >= 12345') 26 #define IMGUI_VERSION "1.90.5 WIP" 27 #define IMGUI_VERSION_NUM 19042 28 #define IMGUI_HAS_TABLE 29 #define IMGUI_HAS_VIEWPORT // Viewport WIP branch 30 #define IMGUI_HAS_DOCK // Docking WIP branch 31 Includes 69 #include <float.h> // FLT_MIN, FLT_MAX 70 #include <stdarg.h> // va_list, va_start, va_end 71 #include <stddef.h> // ptrdiff_t, NULL 72 #include <string.h> // memset, memmove, memcpy, strlen, strchr, strcpy, strcmp 73 74 // Define attributes of all API symbols declarations (e.g. for DLL under Windows) 75 // IMGUI_API is used for core imgui functions, IMGUI_IMPL_API is used for the default backends files (imgui_impl_xxx.h) 76 // Using dear imgui via a shared library is not recommended: we don't guarantee backward nor forward ABI compatibility + this is a call-heavy library and function call overhead adds up. 77 #ifndef IMGUI_API 78 #define IMGUI_API 79 #endif 80 #ifndef IMGUI_IMPL_API 81 #define IMGUI_IMPL_API IMGUI_API 82 #endif 83 84 // Helper Macros 85 #ifndef IM_ASSERT 86 #include <assert.h> 87 #define IM_ASSERT(_EXPR) assert(_EXPR) // You can override the default assert handler by editing imconfig.h 88 #endif 89 #define IM_ARRAYSIZE(_ARR) ((int)(sizeof(_ARR) / sizeof(*(_ARR)))) // Size of a static C-style array. Don't use on pointers! 90 #define IM_UNUSED(_VAR) ((void)(_VAR)) // Used to silence "unused variable warnings". Often useful as asserts may be stripped out from final builds. 91 #define IMGUI_CHECKVERSION() ImGui::DebugCheckVersionAndDataLayout(IMGUI_VERSION, sizeof(ImGuiIO), sizeof(ImGuiStyle), sizeof(ImVec2), sizeof(ImVec4), sizeof(ImDrawVert), sizeof(ImDrawIdx)) 92 93 // Helper Macros - IM_FMTARGS, IM_FMTLIST: Apply printf-style warnings to our formatting functions. 94 // (MSVC provides an equivalent mechanism via SAL Annotations but it would require the macros in a different 95 // location. e.g. #include <sal.h> + void myprintf(_Printf_format_string_ const char* format, ...)) 96 #if !defined(IMGUI_USE_STB_SPRINTF) && defined(__MINGW32__) && !defined(__clang__) 97 #define IM_FMTARGS(FMT) __attribute__((format(gnu_printf, FMT, FMT+1))) 98 #define IM_FMTLIST(FMT) __attribute__((format(gnu_printf, FMT, 0))) 99 #elif !defined(IMGUI_USE_STB_SPRINTF) && (defined(__clang__) || defined(__GNUC__)) 100 #define IM_FMTARGS(FMT) __attribute__((format(printf, FMT, FMT+1))) 101 #define IM_FMTLIST(FMT) __attribute__((format(printf, FMT, 0))) 102 #else 103 #define IM_FMTARGS(FMT) 104 #define IM_FMTLIST(FMT) 105 #endif 106 107 // Disable some of MSVC most aggressive Debug runtime checks in function header/footer (used in some simple/low-level functions) 108 #if defined(_MSC_VER) && !defined(__clang__) && !defined(__INTEL_COMPILER) && !defined(IMGUI_DEBUG_PARANOID) 109 #define IM_MSVC_RUNTIME_CHECKS_OFF __pragma(runtime_checks("",off)) __pragma(check_stack(off)) __pragma(strict_gs_check(push,off)) 110 #define IM_MSVC_RUNTIME_CHECKS_RESTORE __pragma(runtime_checks("",restore)) __pragma(check_stack()) __pragma(strict_gs_check(pop)) 111 #else 112 #define IM_MSVC_RUNTIME_CHECKS_OFF 113 #define IM_MSVC_RUNTIME_CHECKS_RESTORE 114 #endif 115 116 // Warnings 117 #ifdef _MSC_VER 118 #pragma warning (push) 119 #pragma warning (disable: 26495) // [Static Analyzer] Variable 'XXX' is uninitialized. Always initialize a member variable (type.6). 120 #endif 121 #if defined(__clang__) 122 #pragma clang diagnostic push 123 #if __has_warning("-Wunknown-warning-option") 124 #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wunknown-warning-option" // warning: unknown warning group 'xxx' 125 #endif 126 #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wunknown-pragmas" // warning: unknown warning group 'xxx' 127 #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wold-style-cast" 128 #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wfloat-equal" // warning: comparing floating point with == or != is unsafe 129 #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wzero-as-null-pointer-constant" 130 #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wreserved-identifier" // warning: identifier '_Xxx' is reserved because it starts with '_' followed by a capital letter 131 #elif defined(__GNUC__) 132 #pragma GCC diagnostic push 133 #pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wpragmas" // warning: unknown option after '#pragma GCC diagnostic' kind 134 #pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wclass-memaccess" // [__GNUC__ >= 8] warning: 'memset/memcpy' clearing/writing an object of type 'xxxx' with no trivial copy-assignment; use assignment or value-initialization instead 135 #endif 136 137 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------- 138 // [SECTION] Forward declarations and basic types 139 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------- 140 141 // Forward declarations 142 struct ImDrawChannel; // Temporary storage to output draw commands out of order, used by ImDrawListSplitter and ImDrawList::ChannelsSplit() 143 struct ImDrawCmd; // A single draw command within a parent ImDrawList (generally maps to 1 GPU draw call, unless it is a callback) 144 struct ImDrawData; // All draw command lists required to render the frame + pos/size coordinates to use for the projection matrix. 145 struct ImDrawList; // A single draw command list (generally one per window, conceptually you may see this as a dynamic "mesh" builder) 146 struct ImDrawListSharedData; // Data shared among multiple draw lists (typically owned by parent ImGui context, but you may create one yourself) 147 struct ImDrawListSplitter; // Helper to split a draw list into different layers which can be drawn into out of order, then flattened back. 148 struct ImDrawVert; // A single vertex (pos + uv + col = 20 bytes by default. Override layout with IMGUI_OVERRIDE_DRAWVERT_STRUCT_LAYOUT) 149 struct ImFont; // Runtime data for a single font within a parent ImFontAtlas 150 struct ImFontAtlas; // Runtime data for multiple fonts, bake multiple fonts into a single texture, TTF/OTF font loader 151 struct ImFontBuilderIO; // Opaque interface to a font builder (stb_truetype or FreeType). 152 struct ImFontConfig; // Configuration data when adding a font or merging fonts 153 struct ImFontGlyph; // A single font glyph (code point + coordinates within in ImFontAtlas + offset) 154 struct ImFontGlyphRangesBuilder; // Helper to build glyph ranges from text/string data 155 struct ImColor; // Helper functions to create a color that can be converted to either u32 or float4 (*OBSOLETE* please avoid using) 156 struct ImGuiContext; // Dear ImGui context (opaque structure, unless including imgui_internal.h) 157 struct ImGuiIO; // Main configuration and I/O between your application and ImGui 158 struct ImGuiInputTextCallbackData; // Shared state of InputText() when using custom ImGuiInputTextCallback (rare/advanced use) 159 struct ImGuiKeyData; // Storage for ImGuiIO and IsKeyDown(), IsKeyPressed() etc functions. 160 struct ImGuiListClipper; // Helper to manually clip large list of items 161 struct ImGuiOnceUponAFrame; // Helper for running a block of code not more than once a frame 162 struct ImGuiPayload; // User data payload for drag and drop operations 163 struct ImGuiPlatformIO; // Multi-viewport support: interface for Platform/Renderer backends + viewports to render 164 struct ImGuiPlatformMonitor; // Multi-viewport support: user-provided bounds for each connected monitor/display. Used when positioning popups and tooltips to avoid them straddling monitors 165 struct ImGuiPlatformImeData; // Platform IME data for io.SetPlatformImeDataFn() function. 166 struct ImGuiSizeCallbackData; // Callback data when using SetNextWindowSizeConstraints() (rare/advanced use) 167 struct ImGuiStorage; // Helper for key->value storage 168 struct ImGuiStyle; // Runtime data for styling/colors 169 struct ImGuiTableSortSpecs; // Sorting specifications for a table (often handling sort specs for a single column, occasionally more) 170 struct ImGuiTableColumnSortSpecs; // Sorting specification for one column of a table 171 struct ImGuiTextBuffer; // Helper to hold and append into a text buffer (~string builder) 172 struct ImGuiTextFilter; // Helper to parse and apply text filters (e.g. "aaaaa[,bbbbb][,ccccc]") 173 struct ImGuiViewport; // A Platform Window (always 1 unless multi-viewport are enabled. One per platform window to output to). In the future may represent Platform Monitor 174 struct ImGuiWindowClass; // Window class (rare/advanced uses: provide hints to the platform backend via altered viewport flags and parent/child info) 175 176 // Enumerations 177 // - We don't use strongly typed enums much because they add constraints (can't extend in private code, can't store typed in bit fields, extra casting on iteration) 178 // - Tip: Use your programming IDE navigation facilities on the names in the _central column_ below to find the actual flags/enum lists! 179 // In Visual Studio IDE: CTRL+comma ("Edit.GoToAll") can follow symbols in comments, whereas CTRL+F12 ("Edit.GoToImplementation") cannot. 180 // With Visual Assist installed: ALT+G ("VAssistX.GoToImplementation") can also follow symbols in comments. 181 enum ImGuiKey : int; // -> enum ImGuiKey // Enum: A key identifier (ImGuiKey_XXX or ImGuiMod_XXX value) 182 enum ImGuiMouseSource : int; // -> enum ImGuiMouseSource // Enum; A mouse input source identifier (Mouse, TouchScreen, Pen) 183 typedef int ImGuiCol; // -> enum ImGuiCol_ // Enum: A color identifier for styling 184 typedef int ImGuiCond; // -> enum ImGuiCond_ // Enum: A condition for many Set*() functions 185 typedef int ImGuiDataType; // -> enum ImGuiDataType_ // Enum: A primary data type 186 typedef int ImGuiDir; // -> enum ImGuiPopupFlags_ // Flags: for OpenPopup*(), BeginPopupContext*(), IsPopupOpen() 213 typedef int ImGuiSelectableFlags; // -> enum ImGuiSelectableFlags_ // Flags: for Selectable() 214 typedef int ImGuiSliderFlags; // -> enum ImGuiTabItemFlags_ // Flags: for BeginTabItem() 217 typedef int ImGuiTableFlags; // -> enum ImGuiTableFlags_ // Flags: For BeginTable() 218 typedef int ImGuiTableColumnFlags; // -> enum ImGuiTableColumnFlags_// Flags: For TableSetupColumn() 219 typedef int ImGuiTableRowFlags; // -> enum ImGuiViewportFlags_ // Flags: for ImGuiViewport 222 typedef int ImGuiWindowFlags; // -> enum ImGuiWindowFlags_ // Flags: for Begin(), BeginChild() 223 224 // ImTexture: user data for renderer backend to identify a texture [Compile-time configurable type] 225 // - To use something else than an opaque void* pointer: override with e.g. '#define ImTextureID MyTextureType*' in your imconfig.h file. 226 // - This can be whatever to you want it to be! read the FAQ about ImTextureID for details. 227 #ifndef ImTextureID 228 typedef void* ImTextureID; // Default: store a pointer or an integer fitting in a pointer (most renderer backends are ok with that) 229 #endif 230 231 // ImDrawIdx: vertex index. [Compile-time configurable type] 232 // - To use 16-bit indices + allow large meshes: backend need to set 'io.BackendFlags |= ImGuiBackendFlags_RendererHasVtxOffset' and handle ImDrawCmd::VtxOffset (recommended). 233 // - To use 32-bit indices: override with '#define ImDrawIdx unsigned int' in your imconfig.h file. 234 #ifndef ImDrawIdx 235 typedef unsigned short ImDrawIdx; // Default: 16-bit (for maximum compatibility with renderer backends) 236 #endif 237 238 // Scalar data types 239 typedef unsigned int ImGuiID;// A unique ID used by widgets (typically the result of hashing a stack of string) 240 typedef signed char ImS8; // 8-bit signed integer 241 typedef unsigned char ImU8; // 8-bit unsigned integer 242 typedef signed short ImS16; // 16-bit signed integer 243 typedef unsigned short ImU16; // 16-bit unsigned integer 244 typedef signed int ImS32; // 32-bit signed integer == int 245 typedef unsigned int ImU32; // 32-bit unsigned integer (often used to store packed colors) 246 typedef signed long long ImS64; // 64-bit signed integer 247 typedef unsigned long long ImU64; // 64-bit unsigned integer 248 249 // Character types 250 // (we generally use UTF-8 encoded string in the API. This is storage specifically for a decoded character used for keyboard input and display) 251 typedef unsigned int ImWchar32; // A single decoded U32 character/code point. We encode them as multi bytes UTF-8 when used in strings. 252 typedef unsigned short ImWchar16; // A single decoded U16 character/code point. We encode them as multi bytes UTF-8 when used in strings. 253 #ifdef IMGUI_USE_WCHAR32 // ImWchar [configurable type: override in imconfig.h with '#define IMGUI_USE_WCHAR32' to support Unicode planes 1-16] 254 typedef ImWchar32 ImWchar; 255 #else 256 typedef ImWchar16 ImWchar; 257 #endif 258 259 // Callback and functions types 260 typedef int (*ImGuiInputTextCallback)(ImGuiInputTextCallbackData* data); // Callback function for ImGui::InputText() 261 typedef void (*ImGuiSizeCallback)(ImGuiSizeCallbackData* data); // Callback function for ImGui::SetNextWindowSizeConstraints() 262 typedef void* (*ImGuiMemAllocFunc)(size_t sz, void* user_data); // Function signature for ImGui::SetAllocatorFunctions() 263 typedef void (*ImGuiMemFreeFunc)(void* ptr, void* user_data); // Function signature for ImGui::SetAllocatorFunctions() 264 265 // ImVec2: 2D vector used to store positions, sizes etc. [Compile-time configurable type] 266 // This is a frequently used type in the API. Consider using IM_VEC2_CLASS_EXTRA to create implicit cast from/to our preferred type. 267 // Add '#define IMGUI_DEFINE_MATH_OPERATORS' in your imconfig.h file to benefit from courtesy maths operators for those types. 268 IM_MSVC_RUNTIME_CHECKS_OFF 269 struct ImVec2 270 { 271 float x, y; 272 constexpr ImVec2() : x(0.0f), y(0.0f) { } 273 constexpr ImVec2(float _x, float _y) : x(_x), y(_y) { } 274 float& operator[] (size_t idx) { IM_ASSERT(idx == 0 || idx == 1); return ((float*)(void*)(char*)this)[idx]; } // We very rarely use this [] operator, so the assert overhead is fine. 275 float operator[] (size_t idx) const { IM_ASSERT(idx == 0 || idx == 1); return ((const float*)(const void*)(const char*)this)[idx]; } 276 #ifdef IM_VEC2_CLASS_EXTRA 277 IM_VEC2_CLASS_EXTRA // Define additional constructors and implicit cast operators in imconfig.h to convert back and forth between your math types and ImVec2. 278 #endif 279 }; 280 281 // ImVec4: 4D vector used to store clipping rectangles, colors etc. [Compile-time configurable type] 282 struct ImVec4 283 { 284 float x, y, z, w; 285 constexpr ImVec4() : x(0.0f), y(0.0f), z(0.0f), w(0.0f) { } 286 constexpr ImVec4(float _x, float _y, float _z, float _w) : x(_x), y(_y), z(_z), w(_w) { } 287 #ifdef IM_VEC4_CLASS_EXTRA 288 IM_VEC4_CLASS_EXTRA // Define additional constructors and implicit cast operators in imconfig.h to convert back and forth between your math types and ImVec4. 289 #endif 290 }; 291 IM_MSVC_RUNTIME_CHECKS_RESTORE 292 293 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------- 294 // [SECTION] Dear ImGui end-user API functions 295 // (Note that ImGui:: being a namespace, you can add extra ImGui:: functions in your own separate file. Please don't modify imgui source files!) 296 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------- 297 298 namespace ImGui 299 { 300 // Context creation and access 301 // - Each context create its own ImFontAtlas by default. You may instance one yourself and pass it to CreateContext() to share a font atlas between contexts. 302 // - DLL users: heaps and globals are not shared across DLL boundaries! You will need to call SetCurrentContext() + SetAllocatorFunctions() 303 // for each static/DLL boundary you are calling from. Read "Context and Memory Allocators" section of imgui.cpp for details. 304 IMGUI_API ImGuiContext* CreateContext(ImFontAtlas* shared_font_atlas = NULL); 305 IMGUI_API void DestroyContext(ImGuiContext* ctx = NULL); // NULL = destroy current context 306 IMGUI_API ImGuiContext* GetCurrentContext(); 307 IMGUI_API void SetCurrentContext(ImGuiContext* ctx); 308 309 // Main 310 IMGUI_API ImGuiIO& GetIO(); // access the IO structure (mouse/keyboard/gamepad inputs, time, various configuration options/flags) 311 IMGUI_API ImGuiStyle& GetStyle(); // access the Style structure (colors, sizes). Always use PushStyleColor(), PushStyleVar() to modify style mid-frame! 312 IMGUI_API void NewFrame(); // start a new Dear ImGui frame, you can submit any command from this point until Render()/EndFrame(). 313 IMGUI_API void EndFrame(); // ends the Dear ImGui frame. automatically called by Render(). If you don't need to render data (skipping rendering) you may call EndFrame() without Render()... but you'll have wasted CPU already! If you don't need to render, better to not create any windows and not call NewFrame() at all! 314 IMGUI_API void Render(); // ends the Dear ImGui frame, finalize the draw data. You can then get call GetDrawData(). 315 IMGUI_API ImDrawData* GetDrawData(); // valid after Render() and until the next call to NewFrame(). this is what you have to render. 316 317 // Demo, Debug, Information 318 IMGUI_API void ShowDemoWindow(bool* p_open = NULL); // create Demo window. demonstrate most ImGui features. call this to learn about the library! try to make it always available in your application! 319 IMGUI_API void ShowMetricsWindow(bool* p_open = NULL); // create Metrics/Debugger window. display Dear ImGui internals: windows, draw commands, various internal state, etc. 320 IMGUI_API void ShowDebugLogWindow(bool* p_open = NULL); // create Debug Log window. display a simplified log of important dear imgui events. 321 IMGUI_API void ShowIDStackToolWindow(bool* p_open = NULL); // create Stack Tool window. hover items with mouse to query information about the source of their unique ID. 322 IMGUI_API void ShowAboutWindow(bool* p_open = NULL); // create About window. display Dear ImGui version, credits and build/system information. 323 IMGUI_API void ShowStyleEditor(ImGuiStyle* ref = NULL); // add style editor block (not a window). you can pass in a reference ImGuiStyle structure to compare to, revert to and save to (else it uses the default style) 324 IMGUI_API bool ShowStyleSelector(const char* label); // add style selector block (not a window), essentially a combo listing the default styles. 325 IMGUI_API void ShowFontSelector(const char* label); // add font selector block (not a window), essentially a combo listing the loaded fonts. 326 IMGUI_API void ShowUserGuide(); // add basic help/info block (not a window): how to manipulate ImGui as an end-user (mouse/keyboard controls). 327 IMGUI_API const char* GetVersion(); // get the compiled version string e.g. "1.80 WIP" (essentially the value for IMGUI_VERSION from the compiled version of imgui.cpp) 328 329 // Styles 330 IMGUI_API void StyleColorsDark(ImGuiStyle* dst = NULL); // new, recommended style (default) 331 IMGUI_API void StyleColorsLight(ImGuiStyle* dst = NULL); // best used with borders and a custom, thicker font 332 IMGUI_API void StyleColorsClassic(ImGuiStyle* dst = NULL); // classic imgui style 333 334 // Windows 335 // - Begin() = push window to the stack and start appending to it. End() = pop window from the stack. 336 // - Passing 'bool* p_open != NULL' shows a window-closing widget in the upper-right corner of the window, 337 // which clicking will set the boolean to false when clicked. 338 // - You may append multiple times to the same window during the same frame by calling Begin()/End() pairs multiple times. 339 // Some information such as 'flags' or 'p_open' will only be considered by the first call to Begin(). 340 // - Begin() return false to indicate the window is collapsed or fully clipped, so you may early out and omit submitting 341 // anything to the window. Always call a matching End() for each Begin() call, regardless of its return value! 342 // [Important: due to legacy reason, Begin/End and BeginChild/EndChild are inconsistent with all other functions 343 // such as BeginMenu/EndMenu, BeginPopup/EndPopup, etc. where the EndXXX call should only be called if the corresponding 344 // BeginXXX function returned true. Begin and BeginChild are the only odd ones out. Will be fixed in a future update.] 345 // - Note that the bottom of window stack always contains a window called "Debug". 346 IMGUI_API bool Begin(const char* name, bool* p_open = NULL, ImGuiWindowFlags flags = 0); 347 IMGUI_API void End(); 348 349 // Child Windows 350 // - Use child windows to begin into a self-contained independent scrolling/clipping regions within a host window. Child windows can embed their own child. 351 // - Before 1.90 (November 2023), the "ImGuiChildFlags child_flags = 0" parameter was "bool border = false". 352 // This API is backward compatible with old code, as we guarantee that ImGuiChildFlags_Border == true. 353 // Consider updating your old code: 354 // BeginChild("Name", size, false) -> Begin("Name", size, 0); or Begin("Name", size, ImGuiChildFlags_None); 355 // BeginChild("Name", size, true) -> Begin("Name", size, ImGuiChildFlags_Border); 356 // - Manual sizing (each axis can use a different setting e.g. ImVec2(0.0f, 400.0f)): 357 // == 0.0f: use remaining parent window size for this axis. 358 // > 0.0f: use specified size for this axis. 359 // < 0.0f: right/bottom-align to specified distance from available content boundaries. 360 // - Specifying ImGuiChildFlags_AutoResizeX or ImGuiChildFlags_AutoResizeY makes the sizing automatic based on child contents. 361 // Combining both ImGuiChildFlags_AutoResizeX _and_ ImGuiChildFlags_AutoResizeY defeats purpose of a scrolling region and is NOT recommended. 362 // - BeginChild() returns false to indicate the window is collapsed or fully clipped, so you may early out and omit submitting 363 // anything to the window. Always call a matching EndChild() for each BeginChild() call, regardless of its return value. 364 // [Important: due to legacy reason, Begin/End and BeginChild/EndChild are inconsistent with all other functions 365 // such as BeginMenu/EndMenu, BeginPopup/EndPopup, etc. where the EndXXX call should only be called if the corresponding 366 // BeginXXX function returned true. Begin and BeginChild are the only odd ones out. Will be fixed in a future update.] 367 IMGUI_API bool BeginChild(const char* str_id, const ImVec2& size = ImVec2(0, 0), ImGuiChildFlags child_flags = 0, ImGuiWindowFlags window_flags = 0); 368 IMGUI_API bool BeginChild(ImGuiID id, const ImVec2& size = ImVec2(0, 0), ImGuiChildFlags child_flags = 0, ImGuiWindowFlags window_flags = 0); 369 IMGUI_API void EndChild(); 370 371 // Windows Utilities 372 // - 'current window' = the window we are appending into while inside a Begin()/End() block. 'next window' = next window we will Begin() into. 373 IMGUI_API bool IsWindowAppearing(); 374 IMGUI_API bool IsWindowCollapsed(); 375 IMGUI_API bool IsWindowFocused(ImGuiFocusedFlags flags=0); // is current window focused? or its root/child, depending on flags. see flags for options. 376 IMGUI_API bool IsWindowHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags flags=0); // is current window hovered and hoverable (e.g. not blocked by a popup/modal)? See ImGuiHoveredFlags_ for options. IMPORTANT: If you are trying to check whether your mouse should be dispatched to Dear ImGui or to your underlying app, you should not use this function! Use the 'io.WantCaptureMouse' boolean for that! Refer to FAQ entry "How can I tell whether to dispatch mouse/keyboard to Dear ImGui or my application?" for details. 377 IMGUI_API ImDrawList* GetWindowDrawList(); // get draw list associated to the current window, to append your own drawing primitives 378 IMGUI_API float GetWindowDpiScale(); // get DPI scale currently associated to the current window's viewport. 379 IMGUI_API ImVec2 GetWindowPos(); // get current window position in screen space (note: it is unlikely you need to use this. Consider using current layout pos instead, GetCursorScreenPos()) 380 IMGUI_API ImVec2 GetWindowSize(); // get current window size (note: it is unlikely you need to use this. Consider using GetCursorScreenPos() and e.g. GetContentRegionAvail() instead) 381 IMGUI_API float GetWindowWidth(); // get current window width (shortcut for GetWindowSize().x) 382 IMGUI_API float GetWindowHeight(); // get current window height (shortcut for GetWindowSize().y) 383 IMGUI_API ImGuiViewport*GetWindowViewport(); // get viewport currently associated to the current window. 384 385 // Window manipulation 386 // - Prefer using SetNextXXX functions (before Begin) rather that SetXXX functions (after Begin). 387 IMGUI_API void SetNextWindowPos(const ImVec2& pos, ImGuiCond cond = 0, const ImVec2& pivot = ImVec2(0, 0)); // set next window position. call before Begin(). use pivot=(0.5f,0.5f) to center on given point, etc. 388 IMGUI_API void SetNextWindowSize(const ImVec2& size, ImGuiCond cond = 0); // set next window size. set axis to 0.0f to force an auto-fit on this axis. call before Begin() 389 IMGUI_API void SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(const ImVec2& size_min, const ImVec2& size_max, ImGuiSizeCallback custom_callback = NULL, void* custom_callback_data = NULL); // set next window size limits. use 0.0f or FLT_MAX if you don't want limits. Use -1 for both min and max of same axis to preserve current size (which itself is a constraint). Use callback to apply non-trivial programmatic constraints. 390 IMGUI_API void SetNextWindowContentSize(const ImVec2& size); // set next window content size (~ scrollable client area, which enforce the range of scrollbars). Not including window decorations (title bar, menu bar, etc.) nor WindowPadding. set an axis to 0.0f to leave it automatic. call before Begin() 391 IMGUI_API void SetNextWindowCollapsed(bool collapsed, ImGuiCond cond = 0); // set next window collapsed state. call before Begin() 392 IMGUI_API void SetNextWindowFocus(); // set next window to be focused / top-most. call before Begin() 393 IMGUI_API void SetNextWindowScroll(const ImVec2& scroll); // set next window scrolling value (use < 0.0f to not affect a given axis). 394 IMGUI_API void SetNextWindowBgAlpha(float alpha); // set next window background color alpha. helper to easily override the Alpha component of ImGuiCol_WindowBg/ChildBg/PopupBg. you may also use ImGuiWindowFlags_NoBackground. 395 IMGUI_API void SetNextWindowViewport(ImGuiID viewport_id); // set next window viewport 396 IMGUI_API void SetWindowPos(const ImVec2& pos, ImGuiCond cond = 0); // (not recommended) set current window position - call within Begin()/End(). prefer using SetNextWindowPos(), as this may incur tearing and side-effects. 397 IMGUI_API void SetWindowSize(const ImVec2& size, ImGuiCond cond = 0); // (not recommended) set current window size - call within Begin()/End(). set to ImVec2(0, 0) to force an auto-fit. prefer using SetNextWindowSize(), as this may incur tearing and minor side-effects. 398 IMGUI_API void SetWindowCollapsed(bool collapsed, ImGuiCond cond = 0); // (not recommended) set current window collapsed state. prefer using SetNextWindowCollapsed(). 399 IMGUI_API void SetWindowFocus(); // (not recommended) set current window to be focused / top-most. prefer using SetNextWindowFocus(). 400 IMGUI_API void SetWindowFontScale(float scale); // [OBSOLETE] set font scale. Adjust IO.FontGlobalScale if you want to scale all windows. This is an old API! For correct scaling, prefer to reload font + rebuild ImFontAtlas + call style.ScaleAllSizes(). 401 IMGUI_API void SetWindowPos(const char* name, const ImVec2& pos, ImGuiCond cond = 0); // set named window position. 402 IMGUI_API void SetWindowSize(const char* name, const ImVec2& size, ImGuiCond cond = 0); // set named window size. set axis to 0.0f to force an auto-fit on this axis. 403 IMGUI_API void SetWindowCollapsed(const char* name, bool collapsed, ImGuiCond cond = 0); // set named window collapsed state 404 IMGUI_API void SetWindowFocus(const char* name); // set named window to be focused / top-most. use NULL to remove focus. 405 406 // Content region 407 // - Retrieve available space from a given point. Generally GetCursorStartPos() + offset to compute a valid position. 427 428 // Parameters stacks (shared) 429 IMGUI_API void PushFont(ImFont* font); // use NULL as a shortcut to push default font 430 IMGUI_API void PopFont(); 431 IMGUI_API void PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol idx, ImU32 col); // modify a style color. always use this if you modify the style after NewFrame(). 432 IMGUI_API void PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol idx, const ImVec4& col); 433 IMGUI_API void PopStyleColor(int count = 1); 434 IMGUI_API void PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar idx, float val); // modify a style float variable. always use this if you modify the style after NewFrame(). 435 IMGUI_API void PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar idx, const ImVec2& val); // modify a style ImVec2 variable. always use this if you modify the style after NewFrame(). 436 IMGUI_API void PopStyleVar(int count = 1); 437 IMGUI_API void PushTabStop(bool tab_stop); // == tab stop enable. Note that you can call IsItemActive() after any Button() to tell if the button is held in the current frame. 440 IMGUI_API void PopButtonRepeat(); 441 442 // Parameters stacks (current window) 443 IMGUI_API void PushItemWidth(float item_width); // push width of items for common large "item+label" widgets. >0.0f: width in pixels, <0.0f align xx pixels to the right of window (so -FLT_MIN always align width to the right side). 444 IMGUI_API void PopItemWidth(); 445 IMGUI_API void SetNextItemWidth(float item_width); // set width of the _next_ common large "item+label" widget. >0.0f: width in pixels, <0.0f align xx pixels to the right of window (so -FLT_MIN always align width to the right side) 446 IMGUI_API float CalcItemWidth(); // width of item given pushed settings and current cursor position. NOT necessarily the width of last item unlike most 'Item' functions. 447 IMGUI_API void PushTextWrapPos(float wrap_local_pos_x = 0.0f); // push word-wrapping position for Text*() commands. < 0.0f: no wrapping; 0.0f: wrap to end of window (or column); > 0.0f: wrap at 'wrap_pos_x' position in window local space 448 IMGUI_API void PopTextWrapPos(); 449 450 // Style read access 451 // - Use the ShowStyleEditor() function to interactively see/edit the colors. 452 IMGUI_API ImFont* GetFont(); // get current font 453 IMGUI_API float GetFontSize(); // get current font size (= height in pixels) of current font with current scale applied 454 IMGUI_API ImVec2 GetFontTexUvWhitePixel(); // get UV coordinate for a while pixel, useful to draw custom shapes via the ImDrawList API 455 IMGUI_API ImU32 GetColorU32(ImGuiCol idx, float alpha_mul = 1.0f); // retrieve given style color with style alpha applied and optional extra alpha multiplier, packed as a 32-bit value suitable for ImDrawList 456 IMGUI_API ImU32 GetColorU32(const ImVec4& col); // retrieve given color with style alpha applied, packed as a 32-bit value suitable for ImDrawList 457 IMGUI_API ImU32 GetColorU32(ImU32 col, float alpha_mul = 1.0f); // retrieve given color with style alpha applied, packed as a 32-bit value suitable for ImDrawList 458 IMGUI_API const ImVec4& GetStyleColorVec4(ImGuiCol idx); // retrieve style color as stored in ImGuiStyle structure. use to feed back into PushStyleColor(), otherwise use GetColorU32() to get style color with style alpha baked in. 459 460 // Layout cursor positioning 461 // - By "cursor" we mean the current output position. 462 // - The typical widget behavior is to output themselves at the current cursor position, then move the cursor one line down. 463 // - You can call SameLine() between widgets to undo the last carriage return and output at the right of the preceding widget. 464 // - Attention! We currently have inconsistencies between window-local and absolute positions we will aim to fix with future API: 465 // - Absolute coordinate: GetCursorScreenPos(), SetCursorScreenPos(), all ImDrawList:: functions. -> this is the preferred way forward. 466 // - Window-local coordinates: SameLine(), GetCursorPos(), SetCursorPos(), GetCursorStartPos(), GetContentRegionMax(), GetWindowContentRegion*(), PushTextWrapPos() 467 // - GetCursorScreenPos() = GetCursorPos() + GetWindowPos(). GetWindowPos() is almost only ever useful to convert from window-local to absolute coordinates. 468 IMGUI_API ImVec2 GetCursorScreenPos(); // cursor position in absolute coordinates (prefer using this, also more useful to work with ImDrawList API). 469 IMGUI_API void SetCursorScreenPos(const ImVec2& pos); // cursor position in absolute coordinates 470 IMGUI_API ImVec2 GetCursorPos(); // [window-local] cursor position in window coordinates (relative to window position) 471 IMGUI_API float GetCursorPosX(); // [window-local] " 472 IMGUI_API float GetCursorPosY(); // [window-local] " 473 IMGUI_API void SetCursorPos(const ImVec2& local_pos); // [window-local] " 474 IMGUI_API void SetCursorPosX(float local_x); // [window-local] " 475 IMGUI_API void SetCursorPosY(float local_y); // [window-local] " 476 IMGUI_API ImVec2 GetCursorStartPos(); // [window-local] initial cursor position, in window coordinates 477 478 // Other layout functions 479 IMGUI_API void Separator(); // separator, generally horizontal. inside a menu bar or in horizontal layout mode, this becomes a vertical separator. 480 IMGUI_API void SameLine(float offset_from_start_x=0.0f, float spacing=-1.0f); // call between widgets or groups to layout them horizontally. X position given in window coordinates. 481 IMGUI_API void NewLine(); // undo a SameLine() or force a new line when in a horizontal-layout context. 482 IMGUI_API void Spacing(); // add vertical spacing. 483 IMGUI_API void Dummy(const ImVec2& size); // add a dummy item of given size. unlike InvisibleButton(), Dummy() won't take the mouse click or be navigable into. 484 IMGUI_API void Indent(float indent_w = 0.0f); // move content position toward the right, by indent_w, or style.IndentSpacing if indent_w <= 0 485 IMGUI_API void Unindent(float indent_w = 0.0f); // move content position back to the left, by indent_w, or style.IndentSpacing if indent_w <= 0 486 IMGUI_API void BeginGroup(); // lock horizontal starting position 487 IMGUI_API void EndGroup(); // unlock horizontal starting position + capture the whole group bounding box into one "item" (so you can use IsItemHovered() or layout primitives such as SameLine() on whole group, etc.) 488 IMGUI_API void AlignTextToFramePadding(); // vertically align upcoming text baseline to FramePadding.y so that it will align properly to regularly framed items (call if you have text on a line before a framed item) 489 IMGUI_API float GetTextLineHeight(); // ~ FontSize 490 IMGUI_API float GetTextLineHeightWithSpacing(); // ~ FontSize + style.ItemSpacing.y (distance in pixels between 2 consecutive lines of text) 491 IMGUI_API float GetFrameHeight(); // ~ FontSize + style.FramePadding.y * 2 492 IMGUI_API float GetFrameHeightWithSpacing(); // ~ FontSize + style.FramePadding.y * 2 + style.ItemSpacing.y (distance in pixels between 2 consecutive lines of framed widgets) 493 494 // ID stack/scopes 495 // Read the FAQ (docs/FAQ.md or http://dearimgui.com/faq) for more details about how ID are handled in dear imgui. 496 // - Those questions are answered and impacted by understanding of the ID stack system: 497 // - "Q: Why is my widget not reacting when I click on it?" 498 // - "Q: How can I have widgets with an empty label?" 499 // - "Q: How can I have multiple widgets with the same label?" 500 // - Short version: ID are hashes of the entire ID stack. If you are creating widgets in a loop you most likely 501 // want to push a unique identifier (e.g. object pointer, loop index) to uniquely differentiate them. 502 // - You can also use the "Label##foobar" syntax within widget label to distinguish them from each others. 503 // - In this header file we use the "label"/"name" terminology to denote a string that will be displayed + used as an ID, 504 // whereas "str_id" denote a string that is only used as an ID and not normally displayed. 505 IMGUI_API void PushID(const char* str_id); // push string into the ID stack (will hash string). 506 IMGUI_API void PushID(const char* str_id_begin, const char* str_id_end); // push string into the ID stack (will hash string). 507 IMGUI_API void PushID(const void* ptr_id); // push pointer into the ID stack (will hash pointer). 508 IMGUI_API void PushID(int int_id); // push integer into the ID stack (will hash integer). 509 IMGUI_API void PopID(); // pop from the ID stack. 510 IMGUI_API ImGuiID GetID(const char* str_id); // calculate unique ID (hash of whole ID stack + given parameter). e.g. if you want to query into ImGuiStorage yourself 511 IMGUI_API ImGuiID GetID(const char* str_id_begin, const char* str_id_end); 512 IMGUI_API ImGuiID GetID(const void* ptr_id); 513 514 // Widgets: Text 515 IMGUI_API void TextUnformatted(const char* text, const char* text_end = NULL); // raw text without formatting. Roughly equivalent to Text("%s", text) but: A) doesn't require null terminated string if 'text_end' is specified, B) it's faster, no memory copy is done, no buffer size limits, recommended for long chunks of text. 516 IMGUI_API void Text(const char* fmt, ...) IM_FMTARGS(1); // formatted text 517 IMGUI_API void TextV(const char* fmt, va_list args) IM_FMTLIST(1); 518 IMGUI_API void TextColored(const ImVec4& col, const char* fmt, ...) IM_FMTARGS(2); // shortcut for PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_Text, col); Text(fmt, ...); PopStyleColor(); 519 IMGUI_API void TextColoredV(const ImVec4& col, const char* fmt, va_list args) IM_FMTLIST(2); 520 IMGUI_API void TextDisabled(const char* fmt, ...) IM_FMTARGS(1); // shortcut for PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_Text, style.Colors[ImGuiCol_TextDisabled]); Text(fmt, ...); PopStyleColor(); 521 IMGUI_API void TextDisabledV(const char* fmt, va_list args) IM_FMTLIST(1); 522 IMGUI_API void TextWrapped(const char* fmt, ...) IM_FMTARGS(1); // shortcut for PushTextWrapPos(0.0f); Text(fmt, ...); PopTextWrapPos();. Note that this won't work on an auto-resizing window if there's no other widgets to extend the window width, yoy may need to set a size using SetNextWindowSize(). 523 IMGUI_API void TextWrappedV(const char* fmt, va_list args) IM_FMTLIST(1); 524 IMGUI_API void LabelText(const char* label, const char* fmt, ...) IM_FMTARGS(2); // display text+label aligned the same way as value+label widgets 525 IMGUI_API void LabelTextV(const char* label, const char* fmt, va_list args) IM_FMTLIST(2); 526 IMGUI_API void BulletText(const char* fmt, ...) IM_FMTARGS(1); // shortcut for Bullet()+Text() 527 IMGUI_API void BulletTextV(const char* fmt, va_list args) IM_FMTLIST(1); 528 IMGUI_API void SeparatorText(const char* label); // currently: formatted text with an horizontal line 529 530 // Widgets: Main 531 // - Most widgets return true when the value has been changed or when pressed/selected 532 // - You may also use one of the many IsItemXXX functions (e.g. IsItemActive, IsItemHovered, etc.) to query widget state. 533 IMGUI_API bool Button(const char* label, const ImVec2& size = ImVec2(0, 0)); // button 534 IMGUI_API bool SmallButton(const char* label); // button with (FramePadding.y == 0) to easily embed within text 535 IMGUI_API bool InvisibleButton(const char* str_id, const ImVec2& size, ImGuiButtonFlags flags = 0); // draw a small circle + keep the cursor on the same line. advance cursor x position by GetTreeNodeToLabelSpacing(), same distance that TreeNode() uses 544 545 // Widgets: Images 546 // - Read about ImTextureID here: https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/wiki/Image-Loading-and-Displaying-Examples 547 // - 'uv0' and 'uv1' are texture coordinates. Read about them from the same link above. 548 // - Note that Image() may add +2.0f to provided size if a border is visible, ImageButton() adds style.FramePadding*2.0f to provided size. 549 IMGUI_API void Image(ImTextureID user_texture_id, const ImVec2& image_size, const ImVec2& uv0 = ImVec2(0, 0), const ImVec2& uv1 = ImVec2(1, 1), const ImVec4& tint_col = ImVec4(1, 1, 1, 1), const ImVec4& border_col = ImVec4(0, 0, 0, 0)); 550 IMGUI_API bool ImageButton(const char* str_id, ImTextureID user_texture_id, const ImVec2& image_size, const ImVec2& uv0 = ImVec2(0, 0), const ImVec2& uv1 = ImVec2(1, 1), const ImVec4& bg_col = ImVec4(0, 0, 0, 0), const ImVec4& tint_col = ImVec4(1, 1, 1, 1)); 551 552 // Widgets: Combo Box (Dropdown) 553 // - The BeginCombo()/EndCombo() api allows you to manage your contents and selection state however you want it, by creating e.g. Selectable() items. 554 // - The old Combo() api are helpers over BeginCombo()/EndCombo() which are kept available for convenience purpose. This is analogous to how ListBox are created. 555 IMGUI_API bool BeginCombo(const char* label, const char* preview_value, ImGuiComboFlags flags = 0); 556 IMGUI_API void EndCombo(); // only call EndCombo() if BeginCombo() returns true! 557 IMGUI_API bool Combo(const char* label, int* current_item, const char* const items[], int items_count, int popup_max_height_in_items = -1); 558 IMGUI_API bool Combo(const char* label, int* current_item, const char* items_separated_by_zeros, int popup_max_height_in_items = -1); // Separate items with \0 within a string, end item-list with \0\0. e.g. "One\0Two\0Three\0" 559 IMGUI_API bool Combo(const char* label, int* current_item, const char* (*getter)(void* user_data, int idx), void* user_data, int items_count, int popup_max_height_in_items = -1); 560 561 // Widgets: Drag Sliders 562 // - CTRL+Click on any drag box to turn them into an input box. Manually input values aren't clamped by default and can go off-bounds. Use ImGuiSliderFlags_AlwaysClamp to always clamp. 563 // - For all the Float2/Float3/Float4/Int2/Int3/Int4 versions of every function, note that a 'float v[X]' function argument is the same as 'float* v', 564 // the array syntax is just a way to document the number of elements that are expected to be accessible. You can pass address of your first element out of a contiguous set, e.g. &myvector.x 565 // - Adjust format string to decorate the value with a prefix, a suffix, or adapt the editing and display precision e.g. "%.3f" -> 1.234; "%5.2f secs" -> 01.23 secs; "Biscuit: %.0f" -> Biscuit: 1; etc. 566 // - Format string may also be set to NULL or use the default format ("%f" or "%d"). 567 // - Speed are per-pixel of mouse movement (v_speed=0.2f: mouse needs to move by 5 pixels to increase value by 1). For gamepad/keyboard navigation, minimum speed is Max(v_speed, minimum_step_at_given_precision). 568 // - Use v_min < v_max to clamp edits to given limits. Note that CTRL+Click manual input can override those limits if ImGuiSliderFlags_AlwaysClamp is not used. 569 // - Use v_max = FLT_MAX / INT_MAX etc to avoid clamping to a maximum, same with v_min = -FLT_MAX / INT_MIN to avoid clamping to a minimum. 570 // - We use the same sets of flags for DragXXX() and SliderXXX() functions as the features are the same and it makes it easier to swap them. 571 // - Legacy: Pre-1.78 there are DragXXX() function signatures that take a final `float power=1.0f' argument instead of the `ImGuiSliderFlags flags=0' argument. 572 // If you get a warning converting a float to ImGuiSliderFlags, read https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/issues/3361 573 IMGUI_API bool DragFloat(const char* label, float* v, float v_speed = 1.0f, float v_min = 0.0f, float v_max = 0.0f, const char* format = "%.3f", ImGuiSliderFlags flags = 0); Already called by TreeNode() when returning true, but you can call TreePush/TreePop yourself if desired. 648 IMGUI_API void TreePush(const void* ptr_id); // " 649 IMGUI_API void TreePop(); // ~ Unindent()+PopID() 650 IMGUI_API float GetTreeNodeToLabelSpacing(); // horizontal distance preceding label when using TreeNode*() or Bullet() == (g.FontSize + style.FramePadding.x*2) for a regular unframed TreeNode 651 IMGUI_API bool CollapsingHeader(const char* label, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags flags = 0); // if returning 'true' the header is open. doesn't indent nor push on ID stack. user doesn't have to call TreePop(). 652 IMGUI_API bool CollapsingHeader(const char* label, bool* p_visible, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags flags = 0); // when 'p_visible != NULL': if '*p_visible==true' display an additional small close button on upper right of the header which will set the bool to false when clicked, if '*p_visible==false' don't display the header. 653 IMGUI_API void SetNextItemOpen(bool is_open, ImGuiCond cond = 0); // set next TreeNode/CollapsingHeader open state. 654 655 // Widgets: Selectables 656 // - A selectable highlights when hovered, and can display another color when selected. 657 // - Neighbors selectable extend their highlight bounds in order to leave no gap between them. This is so a series of selected Selectable appear contiguous. 658 IMGUI_API bool Selectable(const char* label, bool selected = false, ImGuiSelectableFlags flags = 0, const ImVec2& size = ImVec2(0, 0)); // "bool selected" carry the selection state (read-only). Selectable() is clicked is returns true so you can modify your selection state. size.x==0.0: use remaining width, size.x>0.0: specify width. size.y==0.0: use label height, size.y>0.0: specify height 659 IMGUI_API bool Selectable(const char* label, bool* p_selected, ImGuiSelectableFlags flags = 0, const ImVec2& size = ImVec2(0, 0)); // "bool* p_selected" point to the selection state (read-write), as a convenient helper. 660 661 // Widgets: List Boxes 662 // - This is essentially a thin wrapper to using BeginChild/EndChild with the ImGuiChildFlags_FrameStyle flag for stylistic changes + displaying a label. 663 // - You can submit contents and manage your selection state however you want it, by creating e.g. Selectable() or any other items. 664 // - The simplified/old ListBox() api are helpers over BeginListBox()/EndListBox() which are kept available for convenience purpose. This is analoguous to how Combos are created. 665 // - Choose frame width: size.x > 0.0f: custom / size.x < 0.0f or -FLT_MIN: right-align / size.x = 0.0f (default): use current ItemWidth 666 // - Choose frame height: size.y > 0.0f: custom / size.y < 0.0f or -FLT_MIN: bottom-align / size.y = 0.0f (default): arbitrary default height which can fit ~7 items 667 IMGUI_API bool BeginListBox(const char* label, const ImVec2& size = ImVec2(0, 0)); // open a framed scrolling region 668 IMGUI_API void EndListBox(); // only call EndListBox() if BeginListBox() returned true! 669 IMGUI_API bool ListBox(const char* label, int* current_item, const char* const items[], int items_count, int height_in_items = -1); 670 IMGUI_API bool ListBox(const char* label, int* current_item, const char* (*getter)(void* user_data, int idx), void* user_data, int items_count, int height_in_items = -1); 671 672 // Widgets: Data Plotting 673 // - Consider using ImPlot (https://github.com/epezent/implot) which is much better! 674 IMGUI_API void PlotLines(const char* label, const float* values, int values_count, int values_offset = 0, const char* overlay_text = NULL, float scale_min = FLT_MAX, float scale_max = FLT_MAX, ImVec2 graph_size = ImVec2(0, 0), int stride = sizeof(float)); 675 IMGUI_API void PlotLines(const char* label, float(*values_getter)(void* data, int idx), void* data, int values_count, int values_offset = 0, const char* overlay_text = NULL, float scale_min = FLT_MAX, float scale_max = FLT_MAX, ImVec2 graph_size = ImVec2(0, 0)); 676 IMGUI_API void PlotHistogram(const char* label, const float* values, int values_count, int values_offset = 0, const char* overlay_text = NULL, float scale_min = FLT_MAX, float scale_max = FLT_MAX, ImVec2 graph_size = ImVec2(0, 0), int stride = sizeof(float)); 677 IMGUI_API void PlotHistogram(const char* label, float (*values_getter)(void* data, int idx), void* data, int values_count, int values_offset = 0, const char* overlay_text = NULL, float scale_min = FLT_MAX, float scale_max = FLT_MAX, ImVec2 graph_size = ImVec2(0, 0)); 678 679 // Widgets: Value() Helpers. 680 // - Those are merely shortcut to calling Text() with a format string. Output single value in "name: value" format (tip: freely declare more in your code to handle your types. you can add functions to the ImGui namespace) 681 IMGUI_API void Value(const char* prefix, bool b); 682 IMGUI_API void Value(const char* prefix, int v); 683 IMGUI_API void Value(const char* prefix, unsigned int v); 684 IMGUI_API void Value(const char* prefix, float v, const char* float_format = NULL); 685 686 // Widgets: Menus 687 // - Use BeginMenuBar() on a window ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar to append to its menu bar. 688 // - Use BeginMainMenuBar() to create a menu bar at the top of the screen and append to it. 689 // - Use BeginMenu() to create a menu. You can call BeginMenu() multiple time with the same identifier to append more items to it. 690 // - Not that MenuItem() keyboardshortcuts are displayed as a convenience but _not processed_ by Dear ImGui at the moment. 691 IMGUI_API bool BeginMenuBar(); // append to menu-bar of current window (requires ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar flag set on parent window). 692 IMGUI_API void EndMenuBar(); // only call EndMenuBar() if BeginMenuBar() returns true! 693 IMGUI_API bool BeginMainMenuBar(); // create and append to a full screen menu-bar. 694 IMGUI_API void EndMainMenuBar(); // only call EndMainMenuBar() if BeginMainMenuBar() returns true! 695 IMGUI_API bool BeginMenu(const char* label, bool enabled = true); // create a sub-menu entry. only call EndMenu() if this returns true! 696 IMGUI_API void EndMenu(); // only call EndMenu() if BeginMenu() returns true! 697 IMGUI_API bool MenuItem(const char* label, const char* shortcut = NULL, bool selected = false, bool enabled = true); // return true when activated. 698 IMGUI_API bool MenuItem(const char* label, const char* shortcut, bool* p_selected, bool enabled = true); // return true when activated + toggle (*p_selected) if p_selected != NULL 699 700 // Tooltips 701 // - Tooltips are windows following the mouse. They do not take focus away. 702 // - A tooltip window can contain items of any types. SetTooltip() is a shortcut for the 'if (BeginTooltip()) { Text(...); EndTooltip(); }' idiom. 703 IMGUI_API bool BeginTooltip(); // begin/append a tooltip window. 704 IMGUI_API void EndTooltip(); // only call EndTooltip() if BeginTooltip()/BeginItemTooltip() returns true! 705 IMGUI_API void SetTooltip(const char* fmt, ...) IM_FMTARGS(1); // set a text-only tooltip. Often used after a ImGui::IsItemHovered() check. Override any previous call to SetTooltip(). 706 IMGUI_API void SetTooltipV(const char* fmt, va_list args) IM_FMTLIST(1); 707 708 // Tooltips: helpers for showing a tooltip when hovering an item 709 // - BeginItemTooltip() is a shortcut for the 'if (IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_ForTooltip) && BeginTooltip())' idiom. 710 // - SetItemTooltip() is a shortcut for the 'if (IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_ForTooltip)) { SetTooltip(...); }' idiom. 711 // - Where 'ImGuiHoveredFlags_ForTooltip' itself is a shortcut to use 'style.HoverFlagsForTooltipMouse' or 'style.HoverFlagsForTooltipNav' depending on active input type. For mouse it defaults to 'ImGuiHoveredFlags_Stationary | ImGuiHoveredFlags_DelayShort'. 712 IMGUI_API bool BeginItemTooltip(); // begin/append a tooltip window if preceding item was hovered. 713 IMGUI_API void SetItemTooltip(const char* fmt, ...) IM_FMTARGS(1); // set a text-only tooltip if preceeding item was hovered. override any previous call to SetTooltip(). 714 IMGUI_API void SetItemTooltipV(const char* fmt, va_list args) IM_FMTLIST(1); 715 716 // Popups, Modals 717 // - They block normal mouse hovering detection (and therefore most mouse interactions) behind them. 718 // - If not modal: they can be closed by clicking anywhere outside them, or by pressing ESCAPE. 719 // - Their visibility state (~bool) is held internally instead of being held by the programmer as we are used to with regular Begin*() calls. 720 // - The 3 properties above are related: we need to retain popup visibility state in the library because popups may be closed as any time. 721 // - You can bypass the hovering restriction by using ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup when calling IsItemHovered() or IsWindowHovered(). 722 // - IMPORTANT: Popup identifiers are relative to the current ID stack, so OpenPopup and BeginPopup generally needs to be at the same level of the stack. 723 // This is sometimes leading to confusing mistakes. May rework this in the future. 724 // - BeginPopup(): query popup state, if open start appending into the window. Call EndPopup() afterwards if returned true. ImGuiWindowFlags are forwarded to the window. 725 // - BeginPopupModal(): block every interaction behind the window, cannot be closed by user, add a dimming background, has a title bar. 726 IMGUI_API bool BeginPopup(const char* str_id, ImGuiWindowFlags flags = 0); // return true if the popup is open, and you can start outputting to it. 727 IMGUI_API bool BeginPopupModal(const char* name, bool* p_open = NULL, ImGuiWindowFlags flags = 0); // return true if the modal is open, and you can start outputting to it. 728 IMGUI_API void EndPopup(); // only call EndPopup() if BeginPopupXXX() returns true! 729 730 // Popups: open/close functions 731 // - OpenPopup(): set popup state to open. ImGuiPopupFlags are available for opening options. 732 // - If not modal: they can be closed by clicking anywhere outside them, or by pressing ESCAPE. 733 // - CloseCurrentPopup(): use inside the BeginPopup()/EndPopup() scope to close manually. 734 // - CloseCurrentPopup() is called by default by Selectable()/MenuItem() when activated (FIXME: need some options). 735 // - Use ImGuiPopupFlags_NoOpenOverExistingPopup to avoid opening a popup if there's already one at the same level. This is equivalent to e.g. testing for !IsAnyPopupOpen() prior to OpenPopup(). 736 // - Use IsWindowAppearing() after BeginPopup() to tell if a window just opened. 737 // - IMPORTANT: Notice that for OpenPopupOnItemClick() we exceptionally default flags to 1 (== ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonRight) for backward compatibility with older API taking 'int mouse_button = 1' parameter 738 IMGUI_API void OpenPopup(const char* str_id, ImGuiPopupFlags popup_flags = 0); // call to mark popup as open (don't call every frame!). 739 IMGUI_API void OpenPopup(ImGuiID id, ImGuiPopupFlags popup_flags = 0); // id overload to facilitate calling from nested stacks 740 IMGUI_API void OpenPopupOnItemClick(const char* str_id = NULL, ImGuiPopupFlags popup_flags = 1); // helper to open popup when clicked on last item. Default to ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonRight == 1. (note: actually triggers on the mouse _released_ event to be consistent with popup behaviors) 741 IMGUI_API void CloseCurrentPopup(); // manually close the popup we have begin-ed into. 742 743 // Popups: open+begin combined functions helpers 744 // - Helpers to do OpenPopup+BeginPopup where the Open action is triggered by e.g. hovering an item and right-clicking. 745 // - They are convenient to easily create context menus, hence the name. 746 // - IMPORTANT: Notice that BeginPopupContextXXX takes ImGuiPopupFlags just like OpenPopup() and unlike BeginPopup(). For full consistency, we may add ImGuiWindowFlags to the BeginPopupContextXXX functions in the future. 747 // - IMPORTANT: Notice that we exceptionally default their flags to 1 (== ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonRight) for backward compatibility with older API taking 'int mouse_button = 1' parameter, so if you add other flags remember to re-add the ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonRight. 748 IMGUI_API bool BeginPopupContextItem(const char* str_id = NULL, ImGuiPopupFlags popup_flags = 1); // open+begin popup when clicked on last item. Use str_id==NULL to associate the popup to previous item. If you want to use that on a non-interactive item such as Text() you need to pass in an explicit ID here. read comments in .cpp! 749 IMGUI_API bool BeginPopupContextWindow(const char* str_id = NULL, ImGuiPopupFlags popup_flags = 1);// open+begin popup when clicked on current window. 750 IMGUI_API bool BeginPopupContextVoid(const char* str_id = NULL, ImGuiPopupFlags popup_flags = 1); // open+begin popup when clicked in void (where there are no windows). 751 752 // Popups: query functions 753 // - IsPopupOpen(): return true if the popup is open at the current BeginPopup() level of the popup stack. 754 // - IsPopupOpen() with ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupId: return true if any popup is open at the current BeginPopup() level of the popup stack. 755 // - IsPopupOpen() with ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupId + ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupLevel: return true if any popup is open. 756 IMGUI_API bool IsPopupOpen(const char* str_id, ImGuiPopupFlags flags = 0); // return true if the popup is open. 757 758 // Tables 759 // - Full-featured replacement for old Columns API. 760 // - See Demo->Tables for demo code. See top of imgui_tables.cpp for general commentary. 761 // - See ImGuiTableFlags_ and ImGuiTableColumnFlags_ enums for a description of available flags. 762 // The typical call flow is: 763 // - 1. Call BeginTable(), early out if returning false. 764 // - 2. Optionally call TableSetupColumn() to submit column name/flags/defaults. 765 // - 3. Optionally call TableSetupScrollFreeze() to request scroll freezing of columns/rows. 766 // - 4. Optionally call TableHeadersRow() to submit a header row. Names are pulled from TableSetupColumn() data. 767 // - 5. Populate contents: 768 // - In most situations you can use TableNextRow() + TableSetColumnIndex(N) to start appending into a column. 769 // - If you are using tables as a sort of grid, where every column is holding the same type of contents, 770 // you may prefer using TableNextColumn() instead of TableNextRow() + TableSetColumnIndex(). 771 // TableNextColumn() will automatically wrap-around into the next row if needed. 772 // - IMPORTANT: Comparatively to the old Columns() API, we need to call TableNextColumn() for the first column! 773 // - Summary of possible call flow: 774 // - TableNextRow() -> TableSetColumnIndex(0) -> Text("Hello 0") -> TableSetColumnIndex(1) -> Text("Hello 1") // OK 775 // - TableNextRow() -> TableNextColumn() -> Text("Hello 0") -> TableNextColumn() -> Text("Hello 1") // OK 776 // - TableNextColumn() -> Text("Hello 0") -> TableNextColumn() -> Text("Hello 1") // OK: TableNextColumn() automatically gets to next row! 777 // - TableNextRow() -> Text("Hello 0") // Not OK! Missing TableSetColumnIndex() or TableNextColumn()! Text will not appear! 778 // - 5. Call EndTable() 779 IMGUI_API bool BeginTable(const char* str_id, int column, ImGuiTableFlags flags = 0, const ImVec2& outer_size = ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f), float inner_width = 0.0f); 780 IMGUI_API void EndTable(); // only call EndTable() if BeginTable() returns true! 781 IMGUI_API void TableNextRow(ImGuiTableRowFlags row_flags = 0, float min_row_height = 0.0f); // append into the first cell of a new row. 782 IMGUI_API bool TableNextColumn(); // append into the next column (or first column of next row if currently in last column). Return true when column is visible. 783 IMGUI_API bool TableSetColumnIndex(int column_n); // append into the specified column. Return true when column is visible. 784 785 // Tables: Headers & Columns declaration 786 // - Use TableSetupColumn() to specify label, resizing policy, default width/weight, id, various other flags etc. 787 // - Use TableHeadersRow() to create a header row and automatically submit a TableHeader() for each column. 788 // Headers are required to perform: reordering, sorting, and opening the context menu. 789 // The context menu can also be made available in columns body using ImGuiTableFlags_ContextMenuInBody. 790 // - You may manually submit headers using TableNextRow() + TableHeader() calls, but this is only useful in 791 // some advanced use cases (e.g. adding custom widgets in header row). 792 // - Use TableSetupScrollFreeze() to lock columns/rows so they stay visible when scrolled. 793 IMGUI_API void TableSetupColumn(const char* label, ImGuiTableColumnFlags flags = 0, float init_width_or_weight = 0.0f, ImGuiID user_id = 0); 794 IMGUI_API void TableSetupScrollFreeze(int cols, int rows); // lock columns/rows so they stay visible when scrolled. 795 IMGUI_API void TableHeader(const char* label); // submit one header cell manually (rarely used) 796 IMGUI_API void TableHeadersRow(); // submit a row with headers cells based on data provided to TableSetupColumn() + submit context menu 797 IMGUI_API void TableAngledHeadersRow(); // submit a row with angled headers for every column with the ImGuiTableColumnFlags_AngledHeader flag. MUST BE FIRST ROW. 798 799 // Tables: Sorting & Miscellaneous functions 800 // - Sorting: call TableGetSortSpecs() to retrieve latest sort specs for the table. NULL when not sorting. 801 // When 'sort_specs->SpecsDirty == true' you should sort your data. It will be true when sorting specs have 802 // changed since last call, or the first time. Make sure to set 'SpecsDirty = false' after sorting, 803 // else you may wastefully sort your data every frame! 804 // - Functions args 'int column_n' treat the default value of -1 as the same as passing the current column index. 805 IMGUI_API ImGuiTableSortSpecs* TableGetSortSpecs(); // get latest sort specs for the table (NULL if not sorting). Lifetime: don't hold on this pointer over multiple frames or past any subsequent call to BeginTable(). 806 IMGUI_API int TableGetColumnCount(); // return number of columns (value passed to BeginTable) 807 IMGUI_API int TableGetColumnIndex(); // return current column index. 808 IMGUI_API int TableGetRowIndex(); // return current row index. 809 IMGUI_API const char* TableGetColumnName(int column_n = -1); // return "" if column didn't have a name declared by TableSetupColumn(). Pass -1 to use current column. 810 IMGUI_API ImGuiTableColumnFlags TableGetColumnFlags(int column_n = -1); // return column flags so you can query their Enabled/Visible/Sorted/Hovered status flags. Pass -1 to use current column. 811 IMGUI_API void TableSetColumnEnabled(int column_n, bool v);// change user accessible enabled/disabled state of a column. Set to false to hide the column. User can use the context menu to change this themselves (right-click in headers, or right-click in columns body with ImGuiTableFlags_ContextMenuInBody) 812 IMGUI_API void TableSetBgColor(ImGuiTableBgTarget target, ImU32 color, int column_n = -1); // change the color of a cell, row, or column. See ImGuiTableBgTarget_ flags for details. 813 814 // Legacy Columns API (prefer using Tables!) 815 // - You can also use SameLine(pos_x) to mimic simplified columns. 816 IMGUI_API void Columns(int count = 1, const char* id = NULL, bool border = true); 817 IMGUI_API void NextColumn(); // next column, defaults to current row or next row if the current row is finished 818 IMGUI_API int GetColumnIndex(); // get current column index 819 IMGUI_API float GetColumnWidth(int column_index = -1); // get column width (in pixels). pass -1 to use current column 820 IMGUI_API void SetColumnWidth(int column_index, float width); // set column width (in pixels). pass -1 to use current column 821 IMGUI_API float GetColumnOffset(int column_index = -1); // get position of column line (in pixels, from the left side of the contents region). pass -1 to use current column, otherwise 0..GetColumnsCount() inclusive. column 0 is typically 0.0f 822 IMGUI_API void SetColumnOffset(int column_index, float offset_x); // set position of column line (in pixels, from the left side of the contents region). pass -1 to use current column 823 IMGUI_API int GetColumnsCount(); 824 825 // Tab Bars, Tabs 826 // - Note: Tabs are automatically created by the docking system (when in 'docking' branch). Use this to create tab bars/tabs yourself. 827 IMGUI_API bool BeginTabBar(const char* str_id, ImGuiTabBarFlags flags = 0); // create and append into a TabBar 828 IMGUI_API void EndTabBar(); // only call EndTabBar() if BeginTabBar() returns true! 829 IMGUI_API bool BeginTabItem(const char* label, bool* p_open = NULL, ImGuiTabItemFlags flags = 0); // create a Tab. Returns true if the Tab is selected. 830 IMGUI_API void EndTabItem(); // only call EndTabItem() if BeginTabItem() returns true! 831 IMGUI_API bool TabItemButton(const char* label, ImGuiTabItemFlags flags = 0); // create a Tab behaving like a button. return true when clicked. cannot be selected in the tab bar. 832 IMGUI_API void SetTabItemClosed(const char* tab_or_docked_window_label); // notify TabBar or Docking system of a closed tab/window ahead (useful to reduce visual flicker on reorderable tab bars). For tab-bar: call after BeginTabBar() and before Tab submissions. Otherwise call with a window name. 833 834 // Docking 835 // [BETA API] Enable with io.ConfigFlags |= ImGuiConfigFlags_DockingEnable. 836 // Note: You can use most Docking facilities without calling any API. You DO NOT need to call DockSpace() to use Docking! 837 // - Drag from window title bar or their tab to dock/undock. Hold SHIFT to disable docking. 838 // - Drag from window menu button (upper-left button) to undock an entire node (all windows). 839 // - When io.ConfigDockingWithShift == true, you instead need to hold SHIFT to enable docking. 840 // About dockspaces: 841 // - Use DockSpaceOverViewport() to create an explicit dock node covering the screen or a specific viewport. 842 // This is often used with ImGuiDockNodeFlags_PassthruCentralNode to make it transparent. 843 // - Use DockSpace() to create an explicit dock node _within_ an existing window. See Docking demo for details. 844 // - Important: Dockspaces need to be submitted _before_ any window they can host. Submit it early in your frame! 845 // - Important: Dockspaces need to be kept alive if hidden, otherwise windows docked into it will be undocked. 846 // e.g. if you have multiple tabs with a dockspace inside each tab: submit the non-visible dockspaces with ImGuiDockNodeFlags_KeepAliveOnly. 847 IMGUI_API ImGuiID DockSpace(ImGuiID id, const ImVec2& size = ImVec2(0, 0), ImGuiDockNodeFlags flags = 0, const ImGuiWindowClass* window_class = NULL); 848 IMGUI_API ImGuiID DockSpaceOverViewport(const ImGuiViewport* viewport = NULL, ImGuiDockNodeFlags flags = 0, const ImGuiWindowClass* window_class = NULL); 849 IMGUI_API void SetNextWindowDockID(ImGuiID dock_id, ImGuiCond cond = 0); // set next window dock id 850 IMGUI_API void SetNextWindowClass(const ImGuiWindowClass* window_class); // set next window class (control docking compatibility + provide hints to platform backend via custom viewport flags and platform parent/child relationship) 851 IMGUI_API ImGuiID GetWindowDockID(); 852 IMGUI_API bool IsWindowDocked(); // is current window docked into another window? 853 854 // Logging/Capture 855 // - All text output from the interface can be captured into tty/file/clipboard. IM_FMTARGS(1); // pass text data straight to log (without being displayed) 862 IMGUI_API void LogTextV(const char* fmt, va_list args) IM_FMTLIST(1); 863 864 // Drag and Drop 865 // - On source items, call BeginDragDropSource(), if it returns true also call SetDragDropPayload() + EndDragDropSource(). 866 // - On target candidates, call BeginDragDropTarget(), if it returns true also call AcceptDragDropPayload() + EndDragDropTarget(). 867 // - If you stop calling BeginDragDropSource() the payload is preserved however it won't have a preview tooltip (we currently display a fallback "..." tooltip, see #1725) 868 // - An item can be both drag source and drop target. 869 IMGUI_API bool BeginDragDropSource(ImGuiDragDropFlags flags = 0); // call after submitting an item which may be dragged. when this return true, you can call SetDragDropPayload() + EndDragDropSource() 870 IMGUI_API bool SetDragDropPayload(const char* type, const void* data, size_t sz, ImGuiCond cond = 0); // type is a user defined string of maximum 32 characters. Return true when payload has been accepted. 871 IMGUI_API void EndDragDropSource(); // only call EndDragDropSource() if BeginDragDropSource() returns true! 872 IMGUI_API bool BeginDragDropTarget(); // call after submitting an item that may receive a payload. When used in a tab/docking context, tab is selected when clicking the X + closure is not assumed (will wait for user to stop submitting the tab). Otherwise closure is assumed when pressing the X, so if you keep submitting the tab may reappear at end of tab bar. 1053 ImGuiWindowFlags_NoDocking = 1 << 19, // Disable docking of this window 1054 ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNav = ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavFocus, 1055 ImGuiWindowFlags_NoDecoration = ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollbar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoCollapse, 1056 ImGuiWindowFlags_NoInputs = ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMouseInputs | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavFocus, 1057 1058 // [Internal] 1059 ImGuiWindowFlags_NavFlattened = 1 << 23, // [BETA] On child window: share focus scope, allow gamepad/keyboard navigation to cross over parent border to this child or between sibling child windows. 1060 ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow = 1 << 24, // Don't use! BUT it won't update its auto-size while clipped. 1079 // While not perfect, it is a better default behavior as the always-on performance gain is more valuable than the occasional "resizing after becoming visible again" glitch. 1080 // - You may also use ImGuiChildFlags_AlwaysAutoResize to force an update even when child window is not in view. 1081 // HOWEVER PLEASE UNDERSTAND THAT DOING SO WILL PREVENT BeginChild() FROM EVER RETURNING FALSE, disabling benefits of coarse clipping. 1082 enum ImGuiChildFlags_ 1083 { 1084 ImGuiChildFlags_None = 0, 1085 ImGuiChildFlags_Border = 1 << 0, // Show an outer border and enable WindowPadding. (Xbox) ZR (Switch) R2 (PS) [Analog] 1454 ImGuiKey_GamepadL3, // L Stick (Xbox) L3 (Switch) L3 (PS) 1455 ImGuiKey_GamepadR3, // R Stick (Xbox) R3 (Switch) R3 (PS) 1456 ImGuiKey_GamepadLStickLeft, // [Analog] // Move Window (in Windowing mode) 1457 ImGuiKey_GamepadLStickRight, // [Analog] // Move Window (in Windowing mode) 1458 ImGuiKey_GamepadLStickUp, // [Analog] // Move Window (in Windowing mode) 1459 ImGuiKey_GamepadLStickDown, // [Analog] // Move Window (in Windowing mode) 1460 ImGuiKey_GamepadRStickLeft, // [Analog] 1461 ImGuiKey_GamepadRStickRight, // [Analog] 1462 ImGuiKey_GamepadRStickUp, // [Analog] 1463 ImGuiKey_GamepadRStickDown, // [Analog] 1464 1465 // Aliases: Mouse Buttons (auto-submitted from AddMouseButtonEvent() calls) 1466 // - This is mirroring the data also written to io.MouseDown[], io.MouseWheel, in a format allowing them to be accessed via standard key API. 1467 ImGuiKey_MouseLeft, ImGuiKey_MouseRight, ImGuiKey_MouseMiddle, ImGuiKey_MouseX1, ImGuiKey_MouseX2, ImGuiKey_MouseWheelX, ImGuiKey_MouseWheelY, 1468 1469 // [Internal] Reserved for mod storage 1470 ImGuiKey_ReservedForModCtrl, ImGuiKey_ReservedForModShift, ImGuiKey_ReservedForModAlt, ImGuiKey_ReservedForModSuper, 1471 ImGuiKey_COUNT, 1472 1473 // Keyboard Modifiers (explicitly submitted by backend via AddKeyEvent() calls) 1474 // - This is mirroring the data also written to io.KeyCtrl, io.KeyShift, io.KeyAlt, io.KeySuper, in a format allowing 1475 // them to be accessed via standard key API, allowing calls such as IsKeyPressed(), IsKeyReleased(), querying duration etc. 1476 // - Code polling every key (e.g. an interface to detect a key press for input mapping) might want to ignore those 1477 // and prefer using the real keys (e.g. ImGuiKey_LeftCtrl, ImGuiKey_RightCtrl instead of ImGuiMod_Ctrl). 1478 // - In theory the value of keyboard modifiers should be roughly equivalent to a logical or of the equivalent left/right keys. 1479 // In practice: it's complicated; mods are often provided from different sources. Keyboard layout, IME, sticky keys and 1480 // backends tend to interfere and break that equivalence. The safer decision is to relay that ambiguity down to the end-user... 1481 ImGuiMod_None = 0, 1482 ImGuiMod_Ctrl = 1 << 12, // Ctrl 1483 ImGuiMod_Shift = 1 << 13, // Shift 1484 ImGuiMod_Alt = 1 << 14, // Option/Menu 1485 ImGuiMod_Super = 1 << 15, // Cmd/Super/Windows 1486 ImGuiMod_Shortcut = 1 << 11, // Alias for Ctrl (non-macOS) _or_ Super (macOS). 1487 ImGuiMod_Mask_ = 0xF800, // 5-bits 1488 1489 // [Internal] Prior to 1.87 we required user to fill io.KeysDown[512] using their own native index + the io.KeyMap[] array. 1490 // We are ditching this method but keeping a legacy path for user code doing e.g. IsKeyPressed(MY_NATIVE_KEY_CODE) 1491 // If you need to iterate all keys (for e.g. an input mapper) you may use ImGuiKey_NamedKey_BEGIN..ImGuiKey_NamedKey_END. 1492 ImGuiKey_NamedKey_BEGIN = 512, 1493 ImGuiKey_NamedKey_END = ImGuiKey_COUNT, 1494 ImGuiKey_NamedKey_COUNT = ImGuiKey_NamedKey_END - ImGuiKey_NamedKey_BEGIN, 1495 #ifdef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_KEYIO 1496 ImGuiKey_KeysData_SIZE = ImGuiKey_NamedKey_COUNT, // Size of KeysData[]: only hold named keys 1497 ImGuiKey_KeysData_OFFSET = ImGuiKey_NamedKey_BEGIN, // Accesses to io.KeysData[] must use (key - ImGuiKey_KeysData_OFFSET) index. 1498 #else 1499 ImGuiKey_KeysData_SIZE = ImGuiKey_COUNT, // Size of KeysData[]: hold legacy 0..512 keycodes + named keys 1500 ImGuiKey_KeysData_OFFSET = 0, // Accesses to io.KeysData[] must use (key - ImGuiKey_KeysData_OFFSET) index. 1501 #endif 1502 1503 #ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS 1504 ImGuiKey_ModCtrl = ImGuiMod_Ctrl, ImGuiKey_ModShift = ImGuiMod_Shift, ImGuiKey_ModAlt = ImGuiMod_Alt, ImGuiKey_ModSuper = ImGuiMod_Super, // Renamed in 1.89 1505 //ImGuiKey_KeyPadEnter = ImGuiKey_KeypadEnter, // Renamed in 1.87 1506 #endif 1507 }; Set by user/application. 1522 enum ImGuiConfigFlags_ 1523 { 1524 ImGuiConfigFlags_None = 0, 1525 ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableKeyboard = 1 << 0, // Master keyboard navigation enable flag. Backend also needs to set ImGuiBackendFlags_HasGamepad. 1527 ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableSetMousePos = 1 << 2, // Instruct navigation to move the mouse cursor. May be useful on TV/console systems where moving a virtual mouse is awkward. Will update io.MousePos and set io.WantSetMousePos=true. If enabled you MUST honor io.WantSetMousePos requests in your backend, otherwise ImGui will react as if the mouse is jumping around back and forth. 1528 ImGuiConfigFlags_NavNoCaptureKeyboard = 1 << 3, // Instruct navigation to not set the io.WantCaptureKeyboard flag when io.NavActive is set. 1529 ImGuiConfigFlags_NoMouse = 1 << 4, // Instruct imgui to clear mouse position/buttons in NewFrame(). This allows ignoring the mouse information set by the backend. 1530 ImGuiConfigFlags_NoMouseCursorChange = 1 << 5, // Instruct backend to not alter mouse cursor shape and visibility. Use if the backend cursor changes are interfering with yours and you don't want to use SetMouseCursor() to change mouse cursor. You may want to honor requests from imgui by reading GetMouseCursor() yourself instead. 1531 1532 // [BETA] Docking 1533 ImGuiConfigFlags_DockingEnable = 1 << 6, // Docking enable flags. 1534 1535 // [BETA] Viewports 1536 // When using viewports it is recommended that your default value for ImGuiCol_WindowBg is opaque (Alpha=1.0) so transition to a viewport won't be noticeable. 1537 ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable = 1 << 10, // Viewport enable flags (require both ImGuiBackendFlags_PlatformHasViewports + ImGuiBackendFlags_RendererHasViewports set by the respective backends) 1538 ImGuiConfigFlags_DpiEnableScaleViewports= 1 << 14, // [BETA: Don't use] FIXME-DPI: Reposition and resize imgui windows when the DpiScale of a viewport changed (mostly useful for the main viewport hosting other window). Note that resizing the main window itself is up to your application. 1539 ImGuiConfigFlags_DpiEnableScaleFonts = 1 << 15, // [BETA: Don't use] FIXME-DPI: Request bitmap-scaled fonts to match DpiScale. This is a very low-quality workaround. The correct way to handle DPI is _currently_ to replace the atlas and/or fonts in the Platform_OnChangedViewport callback, but this is all early work in progress. 1540 1541 // User storage (to allow your backend/engine to communicate to code that may be shared between multiple projects. Those flags are NOT used by core Dear ImGui) 1542 ImGuiConfigFlags_IsSRGB = 1 << 20, // Application is SRGB-aware. 1543 ImGuiConfigFlags_IsTouchScreen = 1 << 21, // Application is using a touch screen instead of a mouse. 1544 }; 1545 1546 // Backend capabilities flags stored in io.BackendFlags. This enables output of large meshes (64K+ vertices) while still using 16-bit indices. 1554 1555 // [BETA] Viewports 1556 ImGuiBackendFlags_PlatformHasViewports = 1 << 10, // Backend Platform supports multiple viewports. 1557 ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseHoveredViewport=1 << 11, // Backend Platform supports calling io.AddMouseViewportEvent() with the viewport under the mouse. IF POSSIBLE, ignore viewports with the ImGuiViewportFlags_NoInputs flag (Win32 backend, GLFW 3.30+ backend can do this, SDL backend cannot). If this cannot be done, Dear ImGui needs to use a flawed heuristic to find the viewport under. 1558 ImGuiBackendFlags_RendererHasViewports = 1 << 12, // Backend Renderer supports multiple viewports.
