This is mainly used to facilitate iterations across all used codepoints. 3198 3199 // Methods 3200 IMGUI_API ImFont(); 3201 IMGUI_API ~ImFont(); 3202 IMGUI_API const ImFontGlyph*FindGlyph(ImWchar c) const; 3203 IMGUI_API const ImFontGlyph*FindGlyphNoFallback(ImWchar c) const; 3204 float GetCharAdvance(ImWchar c) const { return ((int)c < IndexAdvanceX.Size) ? IndexAdvanceX[(int)c] : FallbackAdvanceX; } 3205 bool IsLoaded() const { return ContainerAtlas != NULL; } 3206 const char* GetDebugName() const { return ConfigData ? ConfigData->Name : "<unknown>"; } 3207 3208 // 'max_width' stops rendering after a certain width (could be turned into a 2d size). FLT_MAX to disable. 3209 // 'wrap_width' enable automatic word-wrapping across multiple lines to fit into given width. 0.0f to disable. 3210 IMGUI_API ImVec2 CalcTextSizeA(float size, float max_width, float wrap_width, const char* text_begin, const char* text_end = NULL, const char** remaining = NULL) const; // utf8 3211 IMGUI_API const char* CalcWordWrapPositionA(float scale, const char* text, const char* text_end, float wrap_width) const; 3212 IMGUI_API void RenderChar(ImDrawList* draw_list, float size, const ImVec2& pos, ImU32 col, ImWchar c) const; 3213 IMGUI_API void RenderText(ImDrawList* draw_list, float size, const ImVec2& pos, ImU32 col, const ImVec4& clip_rect, const char* text_begin, const char* text_end, float wrap_width = 0.0f, bool cpu_fine_clip = false) const; 3214 3215 // [Internal] Don't use! 3216 IMGUI_API void BuildLookupTable(); 3217 IMGUI_API void ClearOutputData(); 3218 IMGUI_API void GrowIndex(int new_size); 3219 IMGUI_API void AddGlyph(const ImFontConfig* src_cfg, ImWchar c, float x0, float y0, float x1, float y1, float u0, float v0, float u1, float v1, float advance_x); 3220 IMGUI_API void AddRemapChar(ImWchar dst, ImWchar src, bool overwrite_dst = true); // Makes 'dst' character/glyph points to 'src' character/glyph. Currently needs to be called AFTER fonts have been built. 3221 IMGUI_API void SetGlyphVisible(ImWchar c, bool visible); 3222 IMGUI_API bool IsGlyphRangeUnused(unsigned int c_begin, unsigned int c_last); 3223 }; 3224 3225 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------- 3226 // [SECTION] Viewports 3227 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------- 3228 3229 // Flags stored in ImGuiViewport::Flags, giving indications to the platform backends. 3230 enum ImGuiViewportFlags_ 3231 { 3232 ImGuiViewportFlags_None = 0, 3233 ImGuiViewportFlags_IsPlatformWindow = 1 << 0, // Represent a Platform Window 3234 ImGuiViewportFlags_IsPlatformMonitor = 1 << 1, // Represent a Platform Monitor (unused yet) 3235 ImGuiViewportFlags_OwnedByApp = 1 << 2, // Platform Window: Was created/managed by the user application? (rather than our backend) 3236 ImGuiViewportFlags_NoDecoration = 1 << 3, // Platform Window: Disable platform decorations: title bar, borders, etc. (generally set all windows, but if ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsDecoration is set we only set this on popups/tooltips) 3237 ImGuiViewportFlags_NoTaskBarIcon = 1 << 4, // Platform Window: Disable platform task bar icon (generally set on popups/tooltips, or all windows if ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsNoTaskBarIcon is set) 3238 ImGuiViewportFlags_NoFocusOnAppearing = 1 << 5, // Platform Window: Don't take focus when created. 3239 ImGuiViewportFlags_NoFocusOnClick = 1 << 6, // Platform Window: Don't take focus when clicked on. 3240 ImGuiViewportFlags_NoInputs = 1 << 7, // Platform Window: Make mouse pass through so we can drag this window while peaking behind it. 3241 ImGuiViewportFlags_NoRendererClear = 1 << 8, // Platform Window: Renderer doesn't need to clear the framebuffer ahead (because we will fill it entirely). 3242 ImGuiViewportFlags_NoAutoMerge = 1 << 9, // Platform Window: Avoid merging this window into another host window. This can only be set via ImGuiWindowClass viewport flags override (because we need to now ahead if we are going to create a viewport in the first place!). 3243 ImGuiViewportFlags_TopMost = 1 << 10, // Platform Window: Display on top (for tooltips only). 3244 ImGuiViewportFlags_CanHostOtherWindows = 1 << 11, // Viewport can host multiple imgui windows (secondary viewports are associated to a single window). // FIXME: In practice there's still probably code making the assumption that this is always and only on the MainViewport. Will fix once we add support for "no main viewport". 3245 3246 // Output status flags (from Platform) 3247 ImGuiViewportFlags_IsMinimized = 1 << 12, // Platform Window: Window is minimized, can skip render. When minimized we tend to avoid using the viewport pos/size for clipping window or testing if they are contained in the viewport. 3248 ImGuiViewportFlags_IsFocused = 1 << 13, // Platform Window: Window is focused (last call to Platform_GetWindowFocus() returned true) 3249 }; 3250 3251 // - Currently represents the Platform Window created by the application which is hosting our Dear ImGui windows. 3252 // - With multi-viewport enabled, we extend this concept to have multiple active viewports. 3253 // - In the future we will extend this concept further to also represent Platform Monitor and support a "no main platform window" operation mode. 3254 // - About Main Area vs Work Area: 3255 // - Main Area = entire viewport. 3256 // - Work Area = entire viewport minus sections used by main menu bars (for platform windows), or by task bar (for platform monitor). 3257 // - Windows are generally trying to stay within the Work Area of their host viewport. 3258 struct ImGuiViewport 3259 { 3260 ImGuiID ID; // Unique identifier for the viewport 3261 ImGuiViewportFlags Flags; // See ImGuiViewportFlags_ 3262 ImVec2 Pos; // Main Area: Position of the viewport (Dear ImGui coordinates are the same as OS desktop/native coordinates) 3263 ImVec2 Size; // Main Area: Size of the viewport. 3264 ImVec2 WorkPos; // Work Area: Position of the viewport minus task bars, menus bars, status bars (>= Pos) 3265 ImVec2 WorkSize; // Work Area: Size of the viewport minus task bars, menu bars, status bars (<= Size) 3266 float DpiScale; // 1.0f = 96 DPI = No extra scale. 3267 ImGuiID ParentViewportId; // (Advanced) 0: no parent. Instruct the platform backend to setup a parent/child relationship between platform windows. 3268 ImDrawData* DrawData; // The ImDrawData corresponding to this viewport. Valid after Render() and until the next call to NewFrame(). 3269 3270 // Platform/Backend Dependent Data 3271 // Our design separate the Renderer and Platform backends to facilitate combining default backends with each others. 3272 // When our create your own backend for a custom engine, it is possible that both Renderer and Platform will be handled 3273 // by the same system and you may not need to use all the UserData/Handle fields. 3274 // The library never uses those fields, they are merely storage to facilitate backend implementation. 3275 void* RendererUserData; // void* to hold custom data structure for the renderer (e.g. swap chain, framebuffers etc.). generally set by your Renderer_CreateWindow function. 3276 void* PlatformUserData; // void* to hold custom data structure for the OS / platform (e.g. windowing info, render context). generally set by your Platform_CreateWindow function. 3277 void* PlatformHandle; // void* for FindViewportByPlatformHandle(). (e.g. suggested to use natural platform handle such as HWND, GLFWWindow*, SDL_Window*) 3278 void* PlatformHandleRaw; // void* to hold lower-level, platform-native window handle (under Win32 this is expected to be a HWND, unused for other platforms), when using an abstraction layer like GLFW or SDL (where PlatformHandle would be a SDL_Window*) 3279 bool PlatformWindowCreated; // Platform window has been created (Platform_CreateWindow() has been called). This is false during the first frame where a viewport is being created. 3280 bool PlatformRequestMove; // Platform window requested move (e.g. window was moved by the OS / host window manager, authoritative position will be OS window position) 3281 bool PlatformRequestResize; // Platform window requested resize (e.g. window was resized by the OS / host window manager, authoritative size will be OS window size) 3282 bool PlatformRequestClose; // Platform window requested closure (e.g. window was moved by the OS / host window manager, e.g. pressing ALT-F4) 3283 3284 ImGuiViewport() { memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this)); } 3285 ~ImGuiViewport() { IM_ASSERT(PlatformUserData == NULL && RendererUserData == NULL); } 3286 3287 // Helpers 3288 ImVec2 GetCenter() const { return ImVec2(Pos.x + Size.x * 0.5f, Pos.y + Size.y * 0.5f); } 3289 ImVec2 GetWorkCenter() const { return ImVec2(WorkPos.x + WorkSize.x * 0.5f, WorkPos.y + WorkSize.y * 0.5f); } 3290 }; 3291 3292 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------- 3293 // [SECTION] Platform Dependent Interfaces (for e.g. multi-viewport support) 3294 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------- 3295 // [BETA] (Optional) This is completely optional, for advanced users! 3296 // If you are new to Dear ImGui and trying to integrate it into your engine, you can probably ignore this for now. 3297 // 3298 // This feature allows you to seamlessly drag Dear ImGui windows outside of your application viewport. 3299 // This is achieved by creating new Platform/OS windows on the fly, and rendering into them. 3300 // Dear ImGui manages the viewport structures, and the backend create and maintain one Platform/OS window for each of those viewports. 3301 // 3302 // See Glossary https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/wiki/Glossary for details about some of the terminology. 3303 // See Thread https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/issues/1542 for gifs, news and questions about this evolving feature. 3304 // 3305 // About the coordinates system: 3306 // - When multi-viewports are enabled, all Dear ImGui coordinates become absolute coordinates (same as OS coordinates!) 3307 // - So e.g. ImGui::SetNextWindowPos(ImVec2(0,0)) will position a window relative to your primary monitor! 3308 // - If you want to position windows relative to your main application viewport, use ImGui::GetMainViewport()->Pos as a base position. 3309 // 3310 // Steps to use multi-viewports in your application, when using a default backend from the examples/ folder: 3311 // - Application: Enable feature with 'io.ConfigFlags |= ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable'. 3312 // - Backend: The backend initialization will setup all necessary ImGuiPlatformIO's functions and update monitors info every frame. 3313 // - Application: In your main loop, call ImGui::UpdatePlatformWindows(), ImGui::RenderPlatformWindowsDefault() after EndFrame() or Render(). 3314 // - Application: Fix absolute coordinates used in ImGui::SetWindowPos() or ImGui::SetNextWindowPos() calls. 3315 // 3316 // Steps to use multi-viewports in your application, when using a custom backend: 3317 // - Important: THIS IS NOT EASY TO DO and comes with many subtleties not described here! 3318 // It's also an experimental feature, so some of the requirements may evolve. 3319 // Consider using default backends if you can. Either way, carefully follow and refer to examples/ backends for details. 3320 // - Application: Enable feature with 'io.ConfigFlags |= ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable'. 3321 // - Backend: Hook ImGuiPlatformIO's Platform_* and Renderer_* callbacks (see below). 3322 // Set 'io.BackendFlags |= ImGuiBackendFlags_PlatformHasViewports' and 'io.BackendFlags |= ImGuiBackendFlags_PlatformHasViewports'. 3323 // Update ImGuiPlatformIO's Monitors list every frame. 3324 // Update MousePos every frame, in absolute coordinates. 3325 // - Application: In your main loop, call ImGui::UpdatePlatformWindows(), ImGui::RenderPlatformWindowsDefault() after EndFrame() or Render(). 3326 // You may skip calling RenderPlatformWindowsDefault() if its API is not convenient for your needs. Read comments below. 3327 // - Application: Fix absolute coordinates used in ImGui::SetWindowPos() or ImGui::SetNextWindowPos() calls. 3328 // 3329 // About ImGui::RenderPlatformWindowsDefault(): 3330 // - This function is a mostly a _helper_ for the common-most cases, and to facilitate using default backends. 3331 // - You can check its simple source code to understand what it does. 3332 // It basically iterates secondary viewports and call 4 functions that are setup in ImGuiPlatformIO, if available: 3333 // Platform_RenderWindow(), Renderer_RenderWindow(), Platform_SwapBuffers(), Renderer_SwapBuffers() 3334 // Those functions pointers exists only for the benefit of RenderPlatformWindowsDefault(). 3335 // - If you have very specific rendering needs (e.g. flipping multiple swap-chain simultaneously, unusual sync/threading issues, etc.), 3336 // you may be tempted to ignore RenderPlatformWindowsDefault() and write customized code to perform your renderingg. 3337 // You may decide to setup the platform_io's *RenderWindow and *SwapBuffers pointers and call your functions through those pointers, 3338 // or you may decide to never setup those pointers and call your code directly. They are a convenience, not an obligatory interface. 3339 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------- 3340 3341 // (Optional) Access via ImGui::GetPlatformIO() 3342 struct ImGuiPlatformIO 3343 { 3344 //------------------------------------------------------------------ 3345 // Input - Backend interface/functions + Monitor List 3346 //------------------------------------------------------------------ 3347 3348 // (Optional) Platform functions (e.g. Win32, GLFW, SDL2) 3349 // For reference, the second column shows which function are generally calling the Platform Functions: 3350 // N = ImGui::NewFrame() ~ beginning of the dear imgui frame: read info from platform/OS windows (latest size/position) 3351 // F = ImGui::Begin(), ImGui::EndFrame() ~ during the dear imgui frame 3352 // U = ImGui::UpdatePlatformWindows() ~ after the dear imgui frame: create and update all platform/OS windows 3353 // R = ImGui::RenderPlatformWindowsDefault() ~ render 3354 // D = ImGui::DestroyPlatformWindows() ~ shutdown 3355 // The general idea is that NewFrame() we will read the current Platform/OS state, and UpdatePlatformWindows() will write to it. 3356 // 3357 // The functions are designed so we can mix and match 2 imgui_impl_xxxx files, one for the Platform (~window/input handling), one for Renderer. 3358 // Custom engine backends will often provide both Platform and Renderer interfaces and so may not need to use all functions. 3359 // Platform functions are typically called before their Renderer counterpart, apart from Destroy which are called the other way. 3360 3361 // Platform function --------------------------------------------------- Called by ----- 3362 void (*Platform_CreateWindow)(ImGuiViewport* vp); // . . U . . // Create a new platform window for the given viewport 3363 void (*Platform_DestroyWindow)(ImGuiViewport* vp); // N . U . D // 3364 void (*Platform_ShowWindow)(ImGuiViewport* vp); // . . U . . // Newly created windows are initially hidden so SetWindowPos/Size/Title can be called on them before showing the window 3365 void (*Platform_SetWindowPos)(ImGuiViewport* vp, ImVec2 pos); // . . U . . // Set platform window position (given the upper-left corner of client area) 3366 ImVec2 (*Platform_GetWindowPos)(ImGuiViewport* vp); // N . . . . // 3367 void (*Platform_SetWindowSize)(ImGuiViewport* vp, ImVec2 size); // . . U . . // Set platform window client area size (ignoring OS decorations such as OS title bar etc.) 3368 ImVec2 (*Platform_GetWindowSize)(ImGuiViewport* vp); // N . . . . // Get platform window client area size 3369 void (*Platform_SetWindowFocus)(ImGuiViewport* vp); // N . . . . // Move window to front and set input focus 3370 bool (*Platform_GetWindowFocus)(ImGuiViewport* vp); // . . U . . // 3371 bool (*Platform_GetWindowMinimized)(ImGuiViewport* vp); // N . . . . // Get platform window minimized state. When minimized, we generally won't attempt to get/set size and contents will be culled more easily 3372 void (*Platform_SetWindowTitle)(ImGuiViewport* vp, const char* str); // . . U . . // Set platform window title (given an UTF-8 string) 3373 void (*Platform_SetWindowAlpha)(ImGuiViewport* vp, float alpha); // . . U . . // (Optional) Setup global transparency (not per-pixel transparency) 3374 void (*Platform_UpdateWindow)(ImGuiViewport* vp); // . . U . . // (Optional) Called by UpdatePlatformWindows(). Optional hook to allow the platform backend from doing general book-keeping every frame. 3375 void (*Platform_RenderWindow)(ImGuiViewport* vp, void* render_arg); // . . . R . // (Optional) Main rendering (platform side! This is often unused, or just setting a "current" context for OpenGL bindings). 'render_arg' is the value passed to RenderPlatformWindowsDefault(). 3376 void (*Platform_SwapBuffers)(ImGuiViewport* vp, void* render_arg); // . . . R . // (Optional) Call Present/SwapBuffers (platform side! This is often unused!). 'render_arg' is the value passed to RenderPlatformWindowsDefault(). 3377 float (*Platform_GetWindowDpiScale)(ImGuiViewport* vp); // N . . . . // (Optional) [BETA] FIXME-DPI: DPI handling: Return DPI scale for this viewport. 1.0f = 96 DPI. 3378 void (*Platform_OnChangedViewport)(ImGuiViewport* vp); // . F . . . // (Optional) [BETA] FIXME-DPI: DPI handling: Called during Begin() every time the viewport we are outputting into changes, so backend has a chance to swap fonts to adjust style. 3379 int (*Platform_CreateVkSurface)(ImGuiViewport* vp, ImU64 vk_inst, const void* vk_allocators, ImU64* out_vk_surface); // (Optional) For a Vulkan Renderer to call into Platform code (since the surface creation needs to tie them both). 3380 3381 // (Optional) Renderer functions (e.g. DirectX, OpenGL, Vulkan) 3382 void (*Renderer_CreateWindow)(ImGuiViewport* vp); // . . U . . // Create swap chain, frame buffers etc. (called after Platform_CreateWindow) 3383 void (*Renderer_DestroyWindow)(ImGuiViewport* vp); // N . U . D // Destroy swap chain, frame buffers etc. (called before Platform_DestroyWindow) 3384 void (*Renderer_SetWindowSize)(ImGuiViewport* vp, ImVec2 size); // . . U . . // Resize swap chain, frame buffers etc. (called after Platform_SetWindowSize) 3385 void (*Renderer_RenderWindow)(ImGuiViewport* vp, void* render_arg); // . . . R . // (Optional) Clear framebuffer, setup render target, then render the viewport->DrawData. 'render_arg' is the value passed to RenderPlatformWindowsDefault(). 3386 void (*Renderer_SwapBuffers)(ImGuiViewport* vp, void* render_arg); // . . . R . // (Optional) Call Present/SwapBuffers. 'render_arg' is the value passed to RenderPlatformWindowsDefault(). 3387 3388 // (Optional) Monitor list 3389 // - Updated by: app/backend. Update every frame to dynamically support changing monitor or DPI configuration. 3390 // - Used by: dear imgui to query DPI info, clamp popups/tooltips within same monitor and not have them straddle monitors. 3391 ImVector<ImGuiPlatformMonitor> Monitors; 3392 3393 //------------------------------------------------------------------ 3394 // Output - List of viewports to render into platform windows 3395 //------------------------------------------------------------------ 3396 3397 // Viewports list (the list is updated by calling ImGui::EndFrame or ImGui::Render) 3398 // (in the future we will attempt to organize this feature to remove the need for a "main viewport") 3399 ImVector<ImGuiViewport*> Viewports; // Main viewports, followed by all secondary viewports. 3400 ImGuiPlatformIO() { memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this)); } // Zero clear 3401 }; 3402 3403 // (Optional) This is required when enabling multi-viewport. Represent the bounds of each connected monitor/display and their DPI. 3404 // We use this information for multiple DPI support + clamping the position of popups and tooltips so they don't straddle multiple monitors. 3405 struct ImGuiPlatformMonitor 3406 { 3407 ImVec2 MainPos, MainSize; // Coordinates of the area displayed on this monitor (Min = upper left, Max = bottom right) 3408 ImVec2 WorkPos, WorkSize; // Coordinates without task bars / side bars / menu bars. Used to avoid positioning popups/tooltips inside this region. If you don't have this info, please copy the value for MainPos/MainSize. 3409 float DpiScale; // 1.0f = 96 DPI 3410 void* PlatformHandle; // Backend dependant data (e.g. HMONITOR, GLFWmonitor*, SDL Display Index, NSScreen*) 3411 ImGuiPlatformMonitor() { MainPos = MainSize = WorkPos = WorkSize = ImVec2(0, 0); DpiScale = 1.0f; PlatformHandle = NULL; } 3412 }; 3413 3414 // (Optional) Support for IME (Input Method Editor) via the io.SetPlatformImeDataFn() function. 3415 struct ImGuiPlatformImeData 3416 { 3417 bool WantVisible; // A widget wants the IME to be visible 3418 ImVec2 InputPos; // Position of the input cursor 3419 float InputLineHeight; // Line height 3420 3421 ImGuiPlatformImeData() { memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this)); } 3422 }; 3423 3424 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------- 3425 // [SECTION] Obsolete functions and types 3426 // (Will be removed! Read 'API BREAKING CHANGES' section in imgui.cpp for details) 3427 // Please keep your copy of dear imgui up to date! Occasionally set '#define IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS' in imconfig.h to stay ahead. 3428 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------- 3429 3430 namespace ImGui 3431 { 3432 #ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_KEYIO 3433 IMGUI_API ImGuiKey GetKeyIndex(ImGuiKey key); // map ImGuiKey_* values into legacy native key index. == io.KeyMap[key] 3434 #else 3435 static inline ImGuiKey GetKeyIndex(ImGuiKey key) { IM_ASSERT(key >= ImGuiKey_NamedKey_BEGIN && key < ImGuiKey_NamedKey_END && "ImGuiKey and native_index was merged together and native_index is disabled by IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_KEYIO.
